entry.dcterms:description: parents of minority nationalities express their expectations of the education system; their relation to the nationality language and group, images of their children's future; the importance of promoting handing down the language, preserving nationality roots; participation in running nationality schools; ideas about the future of the children, and motivations behind the decisions related to these plans

The sample focuses on 6 nationalities; within each nationality two subsamples were prepared, a basic and a control sample. Only those parents were included in the basic sample whose children participated in national minority education, whereas the control group consisted of parents whose children did not participate in national minority education. In this latter case the condition of selection was that at least one family member be of national minority origin. 2500 persons were askd to participate in the research.
